Reviews.Title: “Stains on all fabrics, subjected to raunchy videos at inedible b'fast, CREEPY”
Reviews.Author: AnnonUs
Reviews.Content: Do to last minute bookings we ended up with an overnight layover in Dubai so just needed a place to sleep - no beach, no frills, just a bed. Stupid me thought I would "save money" by booking this hotel for something like $70. Taxi both ways to airport cost another $30. - Room EXTREMELY small and DARK - Stains on EVERYTHING made of fabric: towels to curtains - Bathroom ancient - creepy elevator - located on tiny side street off a highway with NOTHING around it except mobile phone spare parts shops: I am NOT exaggerating... Hyatt across highway. We looked at it longingly. - Location makes it VERY difficult to get a taxi. They are already full speeding down the highway. - I am also not exaggerating when I say b'fast was inedible. Had some Russian steamed dough thingy with watery scrambled egg in chaffing dishes, all the while blaring VERY raunchy Russian music videos on a TV. It was like Cafeteria From Hell. Ended up having to eat at airport. It was just foul, foul, foul, foul, foul. Don't even want to think about it. Only reason to stay here is for a business person looking to but mobile phone spare parts. Strange thing is the front desk was actually REALLY friendly and helpful. Go Figure!!! Seemed like they were trying to personally compensate for this horrible hotel!! We've stayed a budget hotels before under similar conditions (wait for connection). A clean room and edible b'fast is not too much to ask for. Should have booked Holiday Inn at the airport. Cost the same.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: annehurst
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel a number of years ago, when my son was about 13 years old. The hotel was perfectly adequate - fairly basic, but good value for money. I recommended it to my mother, when she stayed over in Dubai and she was really happy with it too. The thing that really stood out was the helpfulness of the staff. My son was taken ill in the middle of the night ,with severe chest pains. The security guy carried him down to the lobby and then two of the staff on reception (plus another man, who I later learned was a guest!) took us to the hospital and actually stayed there all night with us. As my son seemed much better the next morning, but needed to wait for the results of some tests, I encouraged them to leave. They did so reluctantly, but told me to ring the hotel to be picked up, when we were ready to go. The guy who picked us up insisted on carrying my son into the hotel (much to his embarassment!!) I would have posted this review sooner, but have only recently learned of Trip Advisor. A very big belated thank you to all concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, with friendly staff and good safe location”
Reviews.Author: LondonFarhad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week, it is in Deira close to the Gold Souk, I loved the Hotel it had excellent food, and staff were so helpful always willing to help you. Small family hotel and good value for money. I was surprised to see so many Russians staying here, the only problem is that the russians queue up for everything breakfast and also there is a free bus service to jumeirah beach for sun worshippers. There are numerous eateries nearby like KFC and Shwarma vendors. Small shop right outside. Lots of interesting shops near the hotel I walked all over to get a feeling of the area its very safe there are always people outside and the Police also patrol. During the Day you should walk to Ther Grand Hyatt its about 5-10 minutes walk by the beach and you will get a spectacular view. I loved my stay here and you can get taxis everywhere. The room was basic with Air Con but what do you expect its 2-3 stars, It was cleaned daily. There is a gym and rooftop pool as well. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good place-low price”
Reviews.Author: sh-trip
Reviews.Content: san marco is a good 2star hotel in heart of dubai.near to main trading part of dubai,it has short distance to major bus stations.clean rooms.at all it worthsby the price. it is not extremly quiet place because of location beside street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money. Free shuttle buses are a lifesaver.”
Reviews.Author: crystalpalace1976
Reviews.Content: I paid about £45 a night for a double, which was way cheaper than anywhere else. We were lucky and had a female taxi driver who knew the hotel from the airport. The hotel is right next to Al Khaleej roundabout 15 mins from the Hyatt. The hotel do not advertise it as being opposite it, and the best map of the hotel is on asiarooms.com. The free shuttle buses to the beach and the mall will save you more money on taxis. Ignore other reviews of a lack of taxis in the area. Due to the credit crunch, they are desperate for tourists and will gladly pick you up. The brekkie was fine, abit like dinner though! The hotel is full of Russians but they were fine. Across the hotel is a local restaurant called al jazeera, where i had a curry dinner for £1.35!! Delicious too. My wife didnt like the area as its full of indians/pakistanis who stared at her and sometimes took photos!. But we never really hung out in this area, so it wasnt a huge problem. The best bet is to take the free shuttle bus to Jumeirah beach then take a bus or taxi to your destination, this saved us alot of money. Everyday they take you to a different mall. Do not take the Friday shuttle bus to Ansar Mall in Sharjah though, that place is awful! The staff were friendly and the rooms were kept clean. Definately reccomended for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: destination35
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during a week when a convention was going on in Dubai, so hotels were either fully booked or more expensive than usual. It is located in easy walking distance to the Gold Souk and is in a very busy area. It is tucked away down a small street and until you reach your room, the hotel doesn't look too bad. However, the room was a very big disappointment. The twin room was extremely cramped and shabby looking. There was nowhere to put your luggage and once the luggage was squeezed in, there wasn't much walking space. There was a horrible stale smell, which you eventually got used to, but the bathroom was really something else. It was disgusting and if we could have found somewhere else that week, we would have. We didn't even want to use it bt needs must. i didn't want to touch anything. The towels, although changed most of the time were old looking and there was nowhere to hand your clothes except a mould ridden clothes line. he grout was black and the shower curtain looked old. There was no bath just an open shower cubicle with a curtain as an enclosure. The breakfast was mainly hot and reasonable which changed daily, but there wasn't a big selection. It would help to have breakfast on till 11am as when you're on holiday, having a lie in is something cherished especially when you have been up till late the night before. Finally, getting a taxi was a major problem, which is surprising considering it's in a very busy location. If you asked the hotel to book you a Taxi, you either waited at least an hour or it didn't turn up. If you ask them where to get a taxi from yourself, you were told from the Grand Hyatt. However this is a good 10-15 minutes walk away, which can seem alot longer when you are walking in the heat. I would give this hotel 1 star, however it does have a swimming pool (which we didn't use). The staff seem friendly enough. The tour operator did not understand or speak english, which made things difficult. At another hotel, their tour operator had been extremely helpful, advising us which buses to get and how much taxis should cost to get to a destination etc. In conclusion, i would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jensine
Reviews.Content: Fairly cheap hotel in the old part of Dubai. Close to many sights along the creek. The hotel is a bit run down but clean. Service is good. They made quite an effort to get a taxi to us thursday night. Breakfast is very strange - mashed potatoes and stew. It seemed more like dinner than breakfast. They say that they have a balcony, but they dont. It is near Hyatt but not right across. We would recommend it, it you need a simple hotel witth good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok except for no internet and taxis”
Reviews.Author: jack1978Singapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed for about 3 days at the San Marco. The breakfast was good for the amount of money paid. There was no internet so I had to bring my laptop to the nearby internet cafes to log on. Clean hotel. Staff at front counter were civil. Latest check-out allowed is 1pm. No loud booming nightclubs which were a big plus! However, it's almost impossible to get a taxi there so I would advise that you have your own driver if you're in Dubai on business.

Reviews.Title: “They Are Racists!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: midastouch2
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the san marco hotel in dubai because i enjoyed my previous stay the last time i was there-i normally stay at deira town hotel, but because of the noise from the nightclub, i decided to try san marco because of reviews i had read. I had an appointment with my doctor in dubai, so i decided to lodge at the san marco once more. I came back from shopping, a day after i had checked in and met my room locked-i couldnt use my room card to open the door. So, i now went to the reception to complain and one of the staff now said 'maybe you've not paid thats why the door isnt opening'. Luckily i had my receipt where i paid for my room for the one week i was going to stay, and instead of apologising, they merely rectified the mistake. I was so angry, i now berated the staff and he even had the nerve to tell me i could go to another hotel if i wasnt satisfied staying there! I now asked them wether that was how they treat their guests or was it because i was black? I noticed i was the only black lodging in the hotel. The only good staff with exceptional customer service was the indian (cant remember his name) that checked me in. Anyway, they can continue having the russians stay in their hotel for all i care-since it belongs to a russian-if thats how they want it! Afterall, there are better hotels in dubai. I've told all my friends worldwide (most of them are white) of my experience, and they vowed never to stay at the san marco. I will never stay there again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 15 Minutes At San Marco”
Reviews.Author: yorkshire10
Reviews.Content: we chose the san marco hotel for the last night of our stay in dubai as it was a bit cheaper and a lot closer to the airport than were wed been staying. after been taken to our room which was small, stuffy and had a distinctive smell we checked the bathroom only to find ants running around the shower, tiles missing from the wall and a dirty shower curtain. we asked to be moved to a different room, to which they obliged only to find it was the same as the previous we therefore checked out immediately and found another hotel. This hotel is well below average and do not reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: nikhildubhashi
Reviews.Content: I would rate my one night stay at San Marco as a pleasant one and good value for money. This hotel is located in Deira Dubai which on the other side of the creek. We paid Dirham 550 for a triple occupancy room. The room was tidy and very well maintained. The bathrooms/toilets were clean. Only complain here was that the hot water pressure was too less and so having a nice hot water bath was not convenient. There is a restaurant in the Hotel which serve buffet as well as ordered food. The food was ok, but the food items in the buffet weren't labeled. So identifying the food items was not straightforward. Fitness freaks would be glad to know that there is a gym in the hotel which can be used by the customers. Its not a big one but has reasonable equipment for a nice little work out. Another thing I liked about this hotel is that there are no noisy night clubs in its vicinity. So no late night music and you can enjoy some peaceful sleep after a tiring day of sightseeing. The room price includes breakfast in the morning. Breakfast is served as a buffet and had a wide variety of options like toast, omelet, samosas, juice, vegetables etc. Due to the short stay we hardly interacted with the staff. But we enjoyed good customer service. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a budget hotel in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SyDame
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff at this 3 star hotel in Deira. We found the location convenient for 'Old Dubai' and there is a bus station near the Hyatt if you do not want to walk or take a taxi. The items at the inclusive breakfast were varied daily but it was hot and there was enough choice. The restaurant menu was sufficient and good value. We always walked back from the Creek and found the souks fascinating. We had two rooms at the hotel; one was slightly better than the other, decoration wise but both were clean. Also, we had asked for a quiet room and they had allocated rooms at the back of the hotel away from the road. The rooftop pool is not heated, has a few seats and loungers and is good enough to sunbathe/cool down in. There is also a reasonable gym. For the price of £50 per room b&b, we couldn't fault it. If you want a 7 star hotel try the Burj!! For anyone new to Dubai, Deira is the old, interesting part - not the modern skyscraper part that could be anywhere in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: holiday_boy84
Reviews.Content: Not one of the most luxurious hotels in dubai but it does provide cheap accommodation. The hotel is mainly for russians and i'm not sure if the breakfast was centred on this or it was more of a local cuisne, it was pretty strange nevertheless! The room was clean and comfortable enough and the air conditioning worked a treat. You need to put the water heater on before you want to have a shower though, i had a cold shower because i hadn't realised straightaway. The pool area is on the roof and is pretty small. There are only 4 sun beds. We managed to get one every day evenutally but not many people were using the pool during our stay. The water is freezing! An importnant note inline with the other reviews, don't underestimate the problems you will face getting a cab! I had read the other reviews but didnt think it would be much of a problem because i have been to dubai before and been followed down the road by cabs. Apparently it is a real problem though, cab drivers dont want to pick people up in busy areas. We aited an hour for a cab the first night, we actually flagged down 5 or 6 and they said no. Then on the last day we actually ordered a cab to the airport and it still took an hour to come to the hotel. We heard on the radio that they are starting a new thing where you can call a number and report cabbies that refuse to take you and they get banned for 10 days so it may not be a problem for much longer

Reviews.Title: “Compliments”
Reviews.Author: ZakItaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San MArco during 10 days. Everithing was wonderful! We arrived at 3.00 am and the welcoming was very warm. Wonderful room.Clean, Safe, The reception attendant are wonderful, very friendly, the restaurant Milano was good and the breakfast good. Thank You San Marco see u the next year Mr Zak Mrs Chiara

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised & good deal too!”
Reviews.Author: KabulKevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed there while transiting and was surprised for the money that the hotel was quite nice. They even have the little magnetic cards instead of keys. It was at or above the level of the chains like Red Roof or LaQuinta. The location is not great if you want to catch a taxi, but there are lots restaurants. For budget traveler, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Dank hole in the wall - don't bother”
Reviews.Author: OzBoutiqueTraveller
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the San Marco in March 2007, on a business trip/holiday. We booked through HotelClub as the rate seemed good and they had a free shuttle bus to the shopping centre. We quickly discovered that most westerners should book a 4 star hotel and expect to pay at least Aus$100 per person per nite if you want your expectations met. The hotel is located off the beaten track in Deira - forget walking to any shopping or restaurants - it sometimes took 20mins to hail a cab, though fortunately these are cheap in Dubai. The hotel is dark and dank - windows look directly at walls next door in most cases. The room was clean but bathroom was massively disappointing - reminder us of communist block rather than the Emirates! Very shabby and water got everywhere. Towels small and scratchy. Breakfast and room service were not up to par for a 3 star hotel - bread was stale, jam tasted likie cordial, breakfast room itself not cleaned properly and the buffet (like the hotel) is over-run with Russian package tourists. I will say though that the front desk staff tried their best to be helpful with tours, phone messages, and directions. But they didn't have a whole let else to work with. My advice - pick a western chain hotel or something 4 star at least. Dubai isn't a cheap place to stay but you will want better than this!

HotelInfo.Name: San Marco Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Khaleej Road, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
